name: Krzysztof Onak
content: Krzysztof Onak Krzysztof Onak Shibulal Family Career Development Assistant Professor Faculty of Computing & Data Sciences Boston University Mailing address: Faculty of Computing & Data Sciences 665 Commonwealth Ave Boston, MA 02215 Office: CDS 1443 E-mail: krzysztof@onak.pl (personal, research) / konak@bu.edu (BU matters, research) I am a Shibulal Family Career Development Assistant Professor in the Faculty of Computing & Data Sciences at Boston University. My interests include theoretical foundations of algorithms for big data and their applications to AI and machine learning. Among many other things, I have worked on algorithms for modern parallel and distributed frameworks and streaming and sublinear-time algorithms. During my time in industry, I have also contributed to many applied projects by designing and implementing efficient algorithms. Before joining Boston University, I was a researcher at the IBM T.J. Watson Research Center, a Simons Postdoctoral Fellow at CMU, and a PhD student at MIT. Recent and current engagements: Workshop on Emerging Models of Colossal Computation (E=mc2) (co-organizer) Workshop on Local Algorithms (WOLA 2022) (PC chair) Simons Semesters on Algorithms for the Massive Parallel Computation Model (co-organizer) STOC 2023 (PC member) Postdocs and students: Esty Kelman (postdoc, co-hosted) Dragos Ristache (PhD student) Themistoklis Haris (PhD student) Zi Song Yeoh (PhD student) Teaching: Algorithmic Techniques for Taming Big Data (Spring 2025) Algorithms for Data Science (Fall 2023) Programming for Data Science (Spring 2022) CV (outdated) Select publications: Walking Randomly, Massively, and Efficiently (with Jakub Łącki, Slobodan Mitrović, and Piotr Sankowski) The 52th ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing (STOC 2020).
